name: High-flow Power & Stability (bed/bank mobilization)
functionStatement: Peak flows reshape channel without chronic instability, redistribute wood and sediment, reset habitats, and supply nutrients to floodplains.
descriptionMarkdown: "Bed sediments mobilize near bankfull (~1-2 yr), maintaining a stable but dynamic channel. Bankfull floods do not cause excessive scour/fill; channel handles transport without frequent failures. Bankfull shear stress fits substrate/banks, indicating stable capacity."
howToMeasureMarkdown: "Estimate critical discharge from Shields using D50 and compare to flood recurrence estimates. Use qualitative checks where data are limited. Use imagery change detection to identify fresh bars or scour after moderate floods and confirm in the field where possible. Compare bankfull width and depth to regional curves for drainage area and slope and flag large departures."

inputs.label: High-flow Power & Stability (bed/bank mobilization)
inputs.helpMarkdown: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Bed mobilizes at appropriate flows for the channel type, often near bankfull. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Slight mismatch. Bed moves below or above expected flows. / Marked mismatch. Bed is often locked or frequently scoured. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Extreme mismatch. Bed rarely moves or is reworked by small floods. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.39)

references: USGS PeakFQ or flow-frequency statistics (where available)
Multi-date NAIP or other aerial imagery for change detection
USGS/NRCS regional bankfull geometry reports (where available)
